pros: The days off, especially the winter break

pros: The staff is incredibly supportive of adjunct professors.

pros: Friendly manager Helpful Constant work Creative ideas encouraged
cons: Very corporate and official - not a lot of room for creative execution

review_title: Job is good as a stepping stone
pros: The benefit package is standard but not amazing, you can find the same offer at other jobs. There's a strong sense of job security as a full-time staff member.
cons:
The in-office politics is out of control. If you are like me (wanting to just focus on without any drama) and want to be professional and cordial.... you won't find that here. I'm try to run out as fast as I can due to management.

Salary increase starts art 0.5% and max at 1.5% across all departments. Increases only go by intervals of about 5 years. There's no reason for anyone to dedicate 5 years of their life for only 0.5% when other companies are offering a 4% raise every couple of years.

pros: 35 hour work week, good people to work with (although only speaking from my department), snow days due to the schools location. Summer Friday's. Good benefits
cons: Not a lot of options for lunch, at least close enough. Anything else will run you about 15 min one way. Most of the work is still by paper, not a lot is automated yet.

job_title: Prefer Not To Say in Suffern, NY
pros: Just a pleasure to work here. The best job I've ever had.
cons: None that I can speak to.

pros: I was a student working at the front desk. All the professors were very helpful and i was always allowed to do my homework when it wasnt busy
cons: Sometimes people who came in or called were very short tempered or rude

pros: Very diverse team to work with
cons: Not much to do, the projects are very random. Feels like an intern

pros: Diversity is important and valued.
cons: None, we have solid employees and management.

review_title: The most horrific experience I've had in 20 years as an educator!
pros: NONE.  Ok, maybe the sweet students.
cons: The most disfunctional administration I've ever experienced.  President has fallen asleep in meetings more than once, the tenured faculty (some) are extremely abusive and overpaid, there is a horrific mold problem in Brucker Hall and the old Academic buildings that has required some people to sue the school (and they've won!) and despite having $ to address the problem, RCC does nothing about it.  Their lack of ethics is astounding.  Perhaps worst of all is that people are terrified of losing their jobs. I've never worked at a college with more lawsuits flying around. It is the MOST TOXIC environment - emotionally and physically - that I have EVER worked in.

job_title: Sociology Instructor-Associate Director of Institutional Research in Suffern, NY
pros: Academic freedom with minimal amount of bureaucracy.. Small class sizes were excellent as well as the audio-visual equipment supplied in the high tech classrooms.
cons: Infrastructure needs to be improved in certain areas of older buildings. Provide greater opportunities for securing grant funding for part- time faculty.

pros: Good benefits, suburban setting and free parking.
cons: Expected to do more with less constantly with little acknowledgement. Senior management doesn't collaborate well with staff and faculty. Low morale. Difficult to advance as culture is to employ  externally instead of promoting from within.

pros: Students are amazing.  They get along and are diverse.  They want to learn and improve their lives.
cons: Faculty are horrible.  Obstructive, resistant, non-creative, not engaged, complainers that are overpaid

job_title: Public Safety Officer in New York, NY
pros: I have learned a lot from working here and exercised my leadership, technical, problem solving and time management skills. It is a small department so we are like a family. The work environment is extremely collaborative and the leadership style is transformational and transitional.
cons: no cons, I enjoyed working here.

pros: Ability to apply knowledge in a educational setting.
cons: no future, no stability, no growth
